Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui

Class GUI

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
it.polimi.ingsw.client.gui.GUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientView
public class GUI extends javafx.application.Application implements ClientView
main class responsible for starting and handling the game GUI

    void
    setup()
    Method setup creates all the stage phases which will be updated in other methods, in particular: - MENU: the game's main menu with Play and Quit buttons; - SETUP: small windows containing player's inserted nickname, the server IP and port; - LOADER: the game loader containing player's chosen color, god power and places their workers; - GUI: the effective game GUI (island board).
    void
    start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
     
    void
    stop()
     
    void
    studentActionReset()
    resets the variables that hold source location, target location and the student to move's id.

      Parameters:

    • getClientController

      public ClientController getClientController()
      Returns:
      the current ClientController

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Method setup creates all the stage phases which will be updated in other methods, in particular: - MENU: the game's main menu with Play and Quit buttons; - SETUP: small windows containing player's inserted nickname, the server IP and port; - LOADER: the game loader containing player's chosen color, god power and places their workers; - GUI: the effective game GUI (island board). Each stage scene is put inside a hashmap, which links their name to their fxml filename.

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws IOException

    • characterChecklist

      public void characterChecklist()
      Displays a window with information about the Character currently in effect. The information is dynamically generated based on the Character that has been played.

    • createModal

      public void createModal(javafx.stage.Stage stage, String title, String asset, javafx.scene.paint.Color color, ArrayList<javafx.scene.text.Text> info)
      Builds and displays a window, containing information that is passed to it, to the user
      Parameters:
      stage - the Stage owner
      title - the title to assign
      asset - asset's filename in order to retrieve it, used as icon for the window in title bar
      color - the background color to be used
      info - actual text to be displayed by the modal

    • getColorImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getColorImage(Color color)
      retrieves the asset matching the Color provided. Does not apply to Towers which have their own color enumeration.
      Parameters:
      color - name of the color
      Returns:
      the corresponding image to the color
      See Also:
      • Image
      • Color

    • getColorImage

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getColorImage(TowerColor towerColor)
      retrieves the asset matching the TowerColor provided. Only applies for Towers.
      Parameters:
      towerColor - name of the Tower's color
      Returns:
      Image
      See Also:
      • TowerColor

    • studentActionReset

      public void studentActionReset()
      resets the variables that hold source location, target location and the student to move's id. Used to perform Undo operations if the user chooses to do so.
      See Also:
      • resetStatus()

    • getControllerFromName

      public GUIController getControllerFromName(String name)
      Returns the Controller which has been mapped to the String provided, each implementing the GUIController interface. Each Controller is in charge of handling specific aspects on the game, thus it's required to get the appropriate one to perform a certain operation
      Parameters:
      name - the String to search the HashMap for the desired controller
      Returns:
      the Controller requested
      See Also:
      • GUIController
      • nameMapController
